result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon A Rieck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Complete Cognitive Behavior course

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 117 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

assigned PO Tom Pierzina

State by Hynek /  Def w/ Atty Betthauser
Amended Info filed
Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
Ct 2 - Dismissed & read-in
CRT:  Plea is F&V made - sufficient factual basis exists to support plea - finds def guilty
Skemp makes recommendation for 3 yrs probation w/ AODA conditions - leaving penalty to CRT...117 days credit...
CRT:  if you Stip to something different send an Order & if you can't agree, set a Motion Hrg
Betthauser/def comment on sentencing
CRT:  you seem motivated now...you've done 117 days & I won't order any more
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 3 yrs Concurrent w/ probation sentence from last week (Ct 4 in 15CF345) w/ conditions:  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  No Contact w/ users or traffickers if illicit drugs or cont subs; Complete Cogntive Behavior course;  Pay CC & DoC fees;  Credit for 117 days

from Atty Betthauser   re: Plea/SEH was set for 9-16-15.  Atty Betthauser will be unable to appear by phone due to conflict w/ schedule & will need case cont'd to next Fel sentencing date.  Atty Betthauser has notified ADA Hynek.
Rescheduled to 9-28-15 @ 8:45
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-28-2015 08:45 am
$5000 Sig bond signed by def

State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Betthauser
Stmt of Neg Plea /  Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads NO CONTEST
Remaining Cts are Dismissed & read-in
Betthauser:  I haven't considered the counterfit vs. imitation
CRT:  I want to give you a chance to look @ that.  There's a substantial difference in potential penalties.  Not something I thought about before CRT & didn't know the plea agreement before CRT & in light of the fact you hadn't gone over specific instructions prior to today I want you to go over the distinction between counterfeit & imiation
Def:  Can I still go forward w/ plea?
CRT:  it's an important distinction
Betthauser:  def wants to go forward today
CRT comments further...it hasn't been discussed w/ def & at first glance it's not particularly clear.  I hear from ADA that she hadn't weighed the distinction between counterfeit & imitation - in light of the potential penalties it's important that this issue be clarified before the plea is taken
Betthauser addresses bond
Hynek: part of me who understands his position wouldn't object but I have concerns about def coming back to CRT as we've had problems in the past
CRT:  I could sentence him on the Misd. charge & then do the bond - CRT sentences def on Ct 4 Only in 15CF345 - 
Plea & SEH on Felony charges is set for 9-16-15 @ 10:30 w/ SLH
$5000 Signature Bond signed by def w/ same conditions & added condition that def abide by the conditions of probation on Ct 4 in 15CF345
Motion for Consolidation w/ cses 15CF345, 15CF166 & 15CM264 - Order consolidating cases in Br 4 signed by SLH
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-11-2015 10:45 am
Final pre-trial at 09-03-2015 09:00 am
Charles Betthauser
Jury trial on September 16, 2015 at 08:45 am.
